Job_Description:
Quantitative Market Data & Risk Analytics Analyst

A leading global financial services organization is seeking a quantitative specialist to support its enterprise market risk analytics capability. This role focuses on strengthening data integrity, modernizing time series infrastructure, and advancing statistical methodologies that underpin risk measurement and reporting across asset classes.

The successful candidate will work at the intersection of quantitative research, data engineering, and applied AI, contributing to the robustness of risk metrics and improving the reliability of large-scale market datasets.

Core Responsibilities

Architect and maintain enterprise-grade frameworks for processing and validating financial time series and liquidity metrics such as trading volume.

Develop sophisticated statistical techniques to detect anomalies, regime shifts, and volatility distortions in market data.

Engineer systematic approaches for handling incomplete or corrupted datasets, including imputation and validation workflows.

Streamline and automate recurring data production pipelines to improve operational efficiency and reliability.

Design extensible data platforms that integrate new feeds and adapt to evolving analytical requirements.

Build and maintain programmatic interfaces and analytical utilities for large-scale time series analysis and visualization.

Develop user-facing analytical tools that support transparent, end-to-end risk data workflows.

Conduct deep statistical analysis on structured and unstructured datasets to evaluate data quality and model effectiveness.

Create and refine prompts for large language models to improve structured market data extraction and transformation.

Implement retrieval-enhanced AI solutions to strengthen information sourcing and analytical outputs.

Collaborate with quantitative risk teams, technology groups, and business stakeholders to deliver production-ready solutions.

Required Background

Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Financial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science.

Strong programming expertise in Python, including object-oriented design principles and extensive use of numerical libraries.

Experience optimizing computational workflows, troubleshooting complex systems, and analyzing legacy codebases.

Demonstrated ability to work with large-scale datasets, including distributed data processing environments.

Solid understanding of financial products and market risk measurement techniques, including simulation-based approaches and sensitivity analysis.

Hands-on experience integrating AI/LLM tools into analytical workflows.

Proven track record of independent problem solving and ownership of technical deliverables.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to produce clear technical documentation and partner across functions.

Preferred Experience

Exposure to model development lifecycles and enterprise risk implementation processes.

Familiarity with modern web technologies and building data-driven front-end applications.

Practical application of retrieval-enhanced AI frameworks for structured data analysis.

Advanced spreadsheet modeling skills.

Professional certifications in finance or risk management are considered a plus.
